title: Salt-affected soils: discovering a missed reality

tasks.task: Discuss the impact of salt-affected soils on agriculture.
subtasks: Explain what saline and sodic soils are.
Describe the effects of soluble salts and sodium ions in soil on plant water absorption.
Mention the factors contributing to low agricultural productivity in such soils.
Mention the extent of salt-affected soils globally.
Explain the natural occurrence of siline and sodic soils in arid, semi-arid, and coastal environments.
Provide an example of a natural saline soil landscape and its agricultural use.
Identify human-induced causes of salinization and sodicity, such as poor irrigation practices.
Discuss the impact of climate change on coastal soils.
Suggest conservation and management practices for salt-affected soils.

tasks.task: Present solutions to address soil salinization and boost productivity.
subtasks: Advocate for the conservation of natural ecosystems susceptible to salinity.
Promote sustainable soil and water management.
Encourage appropriate irrigation and crop adaptation.
Emphasize the need for harmonious soil management practices.
